I decided to remake my site!
I think its looking great!! it looks very professional! i need your C&C tho!

Its Valid HTML too ;) dont believe me? click the icon at the bottom of hte page!

item.title: New Look To Site
item.dc:creator: @welshy welshy
item.description:
@welshy wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:10, topic:123722”][quote author=welshy link=topic=173520.msg1600785#msg1600785 date=1184575432]
good point, ill probably recode for divs tomorrow. but ive seen pros design site with tables
[/quote]

Take it easy. Divs can take a while to learn, and while you’re coding the site, it can be a good learning experience. Good luck. Btw, I’d like to see some sites of those pros, if you can find them easily. Otherwise, don’t worry about it.[/quote] ill have it done in divs by today i know them well enough

Read full topic

item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

welshy:

good point, ill probably recode for divs tomorrow. but ive seen pros design site with tables

Take it easy. Divs can take a while to learn, and while you’re coding the site, it can be a good learning experience. Good luck. Btw, I’d like to see some sites of those pros, if you can find them easily. Otherwise, don’t worry about it.

Read full topic

item.title: New Look To Site
item.dc:creator: @welshy welshy
item.description:
@welshy wrote:

[quote=“xxlegitxx, post:8, topic:123722”][quote author=welshy link=topic=173520.msg1600767#msg1600767 date=1184575003]
oh i know divs! alot actually but im using tables so i can get everything perfect… because with divs you need absolute and relative positioning or floating… but im just experimenting with tables.

i know everyone says tables are really bad and all but alot of pro’s use them so meh.
[/quote]

Divs you only need to float. In any css file, these are my first three lines:

* {
float:left;
}

Positioning is quirky and should be avoided. Float is really the only way to work it out well. And I must say, I haven’t seen many pros use tables. Maybe I’m mistaken. And tables aren’t really bad, don’t get me wrong; it is just that they don’t separate form and function. It’s not compliant with standards, which divs do very well.[/quote] good point, ill probably recode for divs tomorrow. but ive seen pros design site with tables

Read full topic

item.title: New Look To Site
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“welshy, post:7, topic:123722”]oh i know divs! alot actually but im using tables so i can get everything perfect… because with divs you need absolute and relative positioning or floating… but im just experimenting with tables.

i know everyone says tables are really bad and all but alot of pro’s use them so meh.[/quote]

Divs you only need to float. In any css file, these are my first three lines:

* {
float:left;
}

Positioning is quirky and should be avoided. Float is really the only way to work it out well. And I must say, I haven’t seen many pros use tables. Maybe I’m mistaken. And tables aren’t really bad, don’t get me wrong; it is just that they don’t separate form and function. It’s not compliant with standards, which divs do very well.

Read full topic

item.title: New Look To Site
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

[quote=“welshy, post:5, topic:123722”]thanks for the imput… but i forgot to mention its not 100% done im still in the middle of working on it!

and the login form was rushed about 5 mins ago ill fix it up and take your comments into mind![/quote]

Sure. The large text would look better in Arial (Win) or Helvetica (Mac). I see you debugged in Firefox, which is good, because I don’t have to open another browser to see what the hell is going on, but it is a bit messed up in IE. Especially the list. I’ve had a lot of troubles with lists, and basically, the problem with positioning lists is that IE modifies padding while FF modifies margin. A tiny error that causes a lot of grief. Maybe tomorrow I’ll fix it up a bit for you. And again, I stress learning divs and XHTML 1.1. Once you internalize it, you can never turn back.

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: New Look To Site
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

welshy:

now look noob[br][size=1]Posted on: July 15, 2007, 09:10:06 PM[/size][hr]i posted the wrong link [br][size=1]Posted on: July 15, 2007, 09:11:24 PM[/size][hr]lmfao if you click your link it proves you the hell wrong… because the right link actually is valid now i updated it

Aren’t you a vindictive, triple-posting s.o.b?

Anyway, I’d suggest you make a separate CSS file, because the CSS on that site should be longer than a simple 94 lines long. The color scheme is better now, though the blue in the banner sorta clashes for me, not to mention the text is slightly grainy. The buttons are much better, though I think a hover effect would make it really stand out. The bullet images are quite out of place. A simple arrow would do. You spelled password and contact wrong. Again, try using divs, because they are more flexible. Otherwise, I’d say it is one of the better sites I’ve seen. Try getting it either XHTML 1.0 Strict or XHTML 1.1, because more compliancy means more browser cross-compatibility, which is a good thing.

Read full topic

item.title: New Look To Site
item.dc:creator: @xxlegitxx xxlegitxx
item.description:
@xxlegitxx wrote:

Actually. It’s not.

I’d suggest thinking of a color scheme and sticking to it. The green, blue, black, and orange aren’t cutting it. Tables are never standards compliant, so I would also learn divs and their functionality. The banner is mediocre. The buttons are trite, and can be done with much smaller images, and can be more fluid.

Read full topic
